test_cases.test_name: Real-time Spectroscopic Data Processing Latency Test
test_cases.objective: Verify that the custom spectroscopic analysis algorithms process data with <2 second latency as specified in URS-PAT-011.

test_steps.action: Load test dataset containing NIR, Raman, and UV-Vis spectra into the system
test_steps.expected_result: Dataset is successfully loaded and recognized by the system

test_steps.action: Initiate real-time processing of the spectroscopic data
test_steps.expected_result: Processing begins immediately with no errors

test_steps.action: Measure time from data input to processed output for 100 consecutive samples
test_steps.expected_result: All samples processed within 2 seconds

acceptance_criteria: All 100 samples processed within 2 seconds
No processing errors encountered
System maintains stable performance throughout test
data_integrity_requirements: All processing times must be accurately recorded
Original spectra data must remain unaltered
Processing logs must be complete and timestamped

test_cases.objective: Validate that the custom multivariate calibration models meet pharmaceutical-specific accuracy requirements as per URS-PAT-002.

test_steps.action: Load independent validation dataset into the system
test_steps.expected_result: Dataset is successfully loaded and recognized by the system

test_steps.action: Execute predictions using all custom multivariate models (PLS, PCA, SVR, ensemble)
test_steps.expected_result: All models generate predictions without errors

test_steps.action: Compare model predictions with reference analytical results
test_steps.expected_result: Predictions fall within acceptable error margins

test_steps.action: Verify model performance metrics against pharmaceutical standards
test_steps.expected_result: All models meet predefined accuracy requirements

acceptance_criteria: All models demonstrate required predictive accuracy
No systematic errors detected in predictions
Model performance metrics meet pharmaceutical standards
data_integrity_requirements: Original validation data must remain unaltered
All predictions must be traceable to specific models
Comparison results must be fully documented

test_cases.test_name: Verification of Custom Spectroscopic Analysis Algorithms
test_cases.objective: To verify the functionality of proprietary preprocessing algorithms for NIR, Raman, and UV-Vis spectra, including baseline correction and noise reduction.

test_steps.action: Load NIR, Raman, and UV-Vis spectral data into the system.
test_steps.expected_result: Data is successfully loaded and displayed in the system interface.

test_steps.action: Apply proprietary preprocessing algorithms to the loaded spectra.
test_steps.expected_result: Spectra are preprocessed with baseline correction and noise reduction applied.

acceptance_criteria: Preprocessing algorithms execute without errors
Baseline correction and noise reduction meet predefined accuracy thresholds
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all spectral data remains unaltered except for intended preprocessing

test_cases.test_name: Validation of Real-Time Prediction Engine Performance
test_cases.objective: To validate the real-time prediction engine's ability to update results every 5 seconds during manufacturing operations.

test_steps.action: Initiate real-time data streaming from manufacturing process.
test_steps.expected_result: Data stream is established and visible in the system interface.

test_steps.action: Monitor prediction engine updates during a 5-minute manufacturing operation.
test_steps.expected_result: Prediction engine updates results every 5 seconds without delay.

acceptance_criteria: Prediction engine updates results within the 5-second interval
System latency remains below 2 seconds
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all prediction data is accurately timestamped and logged

test_cases.test_name: Validation of Custom Spectroscopic Analysis Algorithms
test_cases.objective: To verify the functionality and accuracy of the custom spectroscopic analysis algorithms including preprocessing, baseline correction, noise reduction, and peak identification.

test_steps.action: Load test spectra samples into the system.
test_steps.expected_result: Spectra are successfully loaded and displayed.

test_steps.action: Apply preprocessing algorithms to the spectra.
test_steps.expected_result: Preprocessed spectra show reduced noise and corrected baselines.

test_steps.action: Execute peak identification and deconvolution.
test_steps.expected_result: Peaks are accurately identified and deconvoluted.

acceptance_criteria: All preprocessing steps complete within 2 seconds.
Peak identification accuracy exceeds 95%.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all spectra data is securely stored and unaltered.

test_cases.objective: To assess the performance of the real-time prediction engine in terms of latency and accuracy during manufacturing operations.

test_steps.action: Start the real-time prediction engine with test batch data.
test_steps.expected_result: Engine initializes and begins processing data.

test_steps.action: Monitor prediction updates during simulated manufacturing operations.
test_steps.expected_result: Predictions update every 5 seconds with accurate results.

test_steps.action: Evaluate system response to varying data loads.
test_steps.expected_result: System maintains performance under maximum data load.

acceptance_criteria: Prediction updates occur within 5-second intervals.
System handles maximum data load without performance degradation.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all prediction data is logged and verifiable.

test_steps.expected_result: Data acquisition begins without errors.

test_cases.objective: Validate the custom multivariate calibration models (PLS, PCA, SVR) for accuracy and reliability in pharmaceutical applications.

test_steps.action: Load the validation data set into the system.
test_steps.expected_result: Data set is successfully loaded and recognized by the system.

test_steps.action: Run the custom multivariate calibration models on the validation data set.
test_steps.expected_result: Models produce accurate and reliable predictions within acceptable error margins.

test_cases.objective: Verify the performance of custom spectroscopic analysis algorithms in processing NIR, Raman, and UV-Vis spectra with proprietary preprocessing and noise reduction techniques.

test_steps.action: Load spectroscopic data sets into the system.
test_steps.expected_result: Data sets are successfully loaded and recognized by the system.

test_steps.action: Apply proprietary preprocessing algorithms to the spectra.
test_steps.expected_result: Spectra are preprocessed according to the proprietary algorithms.

test_steps.action: Execute noise reduction algorithms on the preprocessed spectra.
test_steps.expected_result: Noise is effectively reduced in the spectra.

acceptance_criteria: Spectra are processed within <2 second latency
Noise reduction meets predefined thresholds

test_cases.objective: Validate the functionality of the real-time prediction engine using proprietary content uniformity prediction during blending operations.

test_steps.action: Initiate blending operation and start data collection.
test_steps.expected_result: Data collection begins successfully.

test_steps.action: Feed real-time data into the prediction engine.
test_steps.expected_result: Prediction engine processes data and updates results every 5 seconds.

test_steps.action: Monitor content uniformity predictions during blending.
test_steps.expected_result: Content uniformity predictions are consistent with expected values.

acceptance_criteria: Predictions update every 5 seconds
Content uniformity predictions are within acceptable range
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all prediction data is accurately captured
Maintain audit trail of all prediction updates

test_cases.test_name: Real-time Spectroscopic Data Processing Latency Test
test_cases.objective: Verify that the custom spectroscopic analysis algorithms process data with less than 2 seconds latency as specified in URS-PAT-011.
prerequisites: Test dataset prepared with representative spectra

test_steps.action: Load test dataset containing 1000 spectra samples into the system
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts the dataset without errors

test_steps.action: Initiate real-time processing of the spectra using proprietary algorithms
test_steps.expected_result: Processing begins immediately without delays

test_steps.action: Measure time from data input to processed output for each spectrum
test_steps.expected_result: All processing times are below 2 seconds

acceptance_criteria: Average processing latency across all samples is ≤2 seconds
No single sample exceeds 2.5 seconds processing time
System maintains stable performance throughout the test
regulatory_basis: ICH Q2(R1) Validation of Analytical Procedures
data_integrity_requirements: All processing times must be automatically recorded in secure audit trail
Raw spectra and processed results must maintain chain of custody

test_cases.test_name: Multi-Instrument Data Integration and Synchronization Test
test_cases.objective: Validate the system's ability to simultaneously analyze data from 50 analytical instruments with proper synchronization as per URS-PAT-012 and URS-PAT-021.
prerequisites: System installed with all required interfaces

test_steps.action: Connect 50 analytical instruments to the system using custom APIs
test_steps.expected_result: All instruments are recognized by the system

test_steps.action: Initiate simultaneous data acquisition from all instruments
test_steps.expected_result: Data streams begin without errors from all sources

test_steps.action: Monitor system for 1 hour of continuous operation
test_steps.expected_result: All data streams remain synchronized without data loss

acceptance_criteria: System maintains stable connections to all 50 instruments
Data from all sources remains synchronized within 100ms tolerance
No data loss occurs during the test period
data_integrity_requirements: All instrument connections must be logged with timestamps
Data synchronization metrics must be recorded for audit purposes

test_cases.objective: To verify the accuracy and reliability of the proprietary spectroscopic analysis algorithms in processing NIR, Raman, and UV-Vis spectra.

data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all data processing steps are logged.

test_cases.objective: To validate the real-time prediction engine's ability to update results every 5 seconds during manufacturing operations.

test_steps.action: Start the real-time prediction engine with manufacturing data.
test_steps.expected_result: Engine initializes and begins processing data.

test_steps.action: Monitor the prediction engine's update frequency.
test_steps.expected_result: Results are updated every 5 seconds.

test_steps.expected_result: Predictions are within acceptable accuracy thresholds.

test_cases.objective: Verify the performance of proprietary spectroscopic analysis algorithms in processing NIR, Raman, and UV-Vis spectra with custom preprocessing and noise reduction.
prerequisites: Spectroscopic data sets for NIR, Raman, and UV-Vis
Access to the custom PAT system

test_steps.action: Load spectroscopic data sets into the custom PAT system.
test_steps.expected_result: Data sets are successfully loaded and recognized by the system.

test_steps.action: Apply proprietary preprocessing algorithms to the loaded spectra.
test_steps.expected_result: Spectra are preprocessed with baseline correction and noise reduction applied.

test_steps.action: Execute custom peak identification and deconvolution algorithms.
test_steps.expected_result: Peaks are accurately identified and deconvoluted for complex spectra.

acceptance_criteria: Preprocessing algorithms meet specified accuracy thresholds.
Noise reduction achieves the required signal-to-noise ratio.
Peak identification and deconvolution are within acceptable error margins.
regulatory_basis: ICH Q2(R1) Validation of Analytical Procedures
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all spectroscopic data is securely stored and traceable.
Maintain audit trails for all algorithmic processes.
urs_requirements: URS-PAT-001: Develop custom spectroscopic analysis algorithms
URS-PAT-011: Custom algorithms shall process spectroscopic data in real-time with <2 second latency
related_tests: OQ-016: Custom Multivariate Calibration Model Validation

test_cases.objective: Validate the functionality and accuracy of custom multivariate calibration models including PLS regression, PCA, and SVR.
prerequisites: Access to the custom PAT system

test_steps.action: Load calibration data sets into the custom PAT system.
test_steps.expected_result: Data sets are successfully loaded and recognized by the system.

test_steps.action: Apply proprietary PLS regression models to the calibration data.
test_steps.expected_result: PLS regression models accurately predict the calibration parameters.

test_steps.action: Execute custom PCA for outlier detection.
test_steps.expected_result: Outliers are accurately detected and flagged.

test_steps.action: Apply proprietary SVR models for non-linear relationships.
test_steps.expected_result: SVR models accurately predict non-linear calibration parameters.

acceptance_criteria: PLS regression models meet specified accuracy thresholds.
PCA accurately detects outliers within acceptable error margins.
SVR models achieve the required prediction accuracy for non-linear relationships.
regulatory_basis: ICH Q2(R1) Validation of Analytical Procedures
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all calibration data is securely stored and traceable.
Maintain audit trails for all model validation processes.
urs_requirements: URS-PAT-002: Implement custom multivariate calibration models
URS-PAT-012: System shall simultaneously analyze data from 50 analytical instruments
related_tests: OQ-015: Custom Spectroscopic Algorithm Performance Verification

test_cases.objective: Verify the custom spectroscopic analysis algorithms (URS-PAT-001) correctly process and analyze NIR, Raman, and UV-Vis spectra according to proprietary mathematical techniques.

test_steps.action: Load test dataset containing complex pharmaceutical spectra with known characteristics
test_steps.expected_result: System successfully imports and displays spectral data without errors

test_steps.action: Execute proprietary preprocessing algorithms including baseline correction and noise reduction
test_steps.expected_result: Processed spectra show proper baseline flattening and noise reduction while preserving critical features

test_steps.action: Run custom peak identification and deconvolution on complex multi-component spectra
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly identifies all expected peaks with accuracy within ±0.5% of reference values

acceptance_criteria: All proprietary algorithms execute without errors
Processed spectra meet predefined quality metrics
Peak identification accuracy within specified tolerance
data_integrity_requirements: Full audit trail of all algorithm executions
Secure storage of raw and processed spectra
Version control for algorithm parameters

test_cases.objective: Validate that the proprietary real-time prediction engine (URS-PAT-003) meets latency and throughput requirements during simulated manufacturing conditions.

test_steps.action: Initiate 50 parallel simulated instrument data streams representing full manufacturing load
test_steps.expected_result: System successfully establishes all data connections without dropped packets

test_steps.action: Execute content uniformity prediction on all streams simultaneously
test_steps.expected_result: All predictions complete within 2 seconds as specified in URS-PAT-011

test_steps.action: Monitor system for 8 hours of continuous operation under load
test_steps.expected_result: System maintains 99.9% uptime with prediction updates every 5 seconds as per URS-PAT-013

acceptance_criteria: All latency requirements met under maximum load
System maintains specified update frequency
No degradation in prediction accuracy over time
data_integrity_requirements: Timestamped record of all predictions
System performance logs
Alert records for any performance deviations
